required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Can Methods From Computational Psychology be Used to Phenotype Individuals Most Likely to be Non-adherent to Fitness Goals?
clinical_study.official_title: Can Methods From Computational Psychology be Used to Phenotype Individuals Most Likely to be Non-adherent to Fitness Goals?

brief_summary.textblock: This is a longitudinal study combining objective sensor data, with decision-making games and contextual personality traits to identify patterns in exercise decay. The data generated will be used to build computational models to predict digital personas, and help identify those individuals most likely to abandon exercise goals.

detailed_description.textblock: Interested individuals to be recruited on social media and invited to download the study app. The plain language statement and informed consent are embedded in the app. Once e-consent is obtained, individuals will share their Fitbit data and complete the following questionnaires; Type D Personality, Goal Setting, and Self-Efficacy questionnaire and a decision-making game based on the IGT. After a 6 month time period, they will be requested to retake the questionnaires and decision-making game.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in physical activity measured by an increase in weekly steps measured by Fitbit.
primary_outcome.description: Fitbit is a physical activity tracker worn on the wrist and objectively measures steps taken.

intervention.description: An application to deliver a series of behavioral questionnaires and decision-making game

study_pop.textblock: Healthy individuals starting a new exercise regime.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy individuals who have a Fitbit
Exclusion Criteria:
- Individuals under the age of 18 years of age.
